ru.myx.ae3.produce

Interface ObjectFactory<S,T>

  • Type Parameters:
    S -
    T -
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    TransformMaterializer, TransformMaterializerSimple

    public interface ObjectFactory<S,T>
    An object to create objects using data specified.

    Some common types:
    - (type) to an (object) - creation
    - (type + attributes) to an (object) - creation
    - (type + attributes + source) to an (object) - creation/conversion
    - (source) to an (object) - conversion
    - (source:Transfer.Buffer) to an (object) - Materialization
    - (source) to a (object:Transfer.Buffer) - Serialization

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean accepts(String variant, BaseObject attributes, Class<?> source)
      Returns true when this factory can produce objects using data provided.
      default ObjectTarget<S> connect(String variant, BaseObject attributes, Class<?> source, ObjectTarget<T> target)
      Creates a target whose absorbation methods will absorb instances of source class and send produced objects to a target specified.
      default ObjectFactory<S,T> factory(String variant, BaseObject attributes, Class<?> source)
      Returns exact factory to produce objects using data provided or null.
      default ObjectSource<T> prepare(String variant, BaseObject attributes, S source)
      Prepares a source to produce objects using data specified.
      T produce(String variant, BaseObject attributes, S source)
      Creates an object using data specified.
      Class<?>[] sources()
      Returns an array of classes and interfaces to be accepted by this factory for production.
      Class<?>[] targets()
      Returns an array of classes and interfaces to be assignable from any object produced by this factory.
      String[] variety()
      Returns an array of type names accepted by this factory.

      • produce

        T produce(String variant,
          BaseObject attributes,
          S source)
        Creates an object using data specified. Only blocking factory can produce objects using this method.
        Parameters:
        variant -
        attributes -
        source -
        Returns:
        object

      • sources

        Class<?>[] sources()
        Returns an array of classes and interfaces to be accepted by this factory for production. Factory will NOT recieve creation request when source class is not compatible with every class declared by this method. Factory MUST return same or equal array on every call. It's recommended to use something like static constant variable to return in this method because some registry factory implementations may call this method frequently. In order to be used when no source object is available (e.g. source is NULL) this array should contain null value. When no source object is needed at all this method may return NULL.
        Returns:
        class array

      • targets

        Class<?>[] targets()
        Returns an array of classes and interfaces to be assignable from any object produced by this factory. Factory will NOT recieve creation request for a class not declared (and not assignable from any declared classes) by this method. Use more specific types here. Factory MUST return same or equal array on every call. It's recommended to use something like static constant variable to return in this method because some registry factory implementations may call this method frequently.
        Returns:
        class array

      • variety

        String[] variety()
        Returns an array of type names accepted by this factory. Factory will NOT recieve creation request for a type not declared by this method. Factory MUST return same or equal array on every call. It's recommended to use something like static constant variable to return in this method because some registry factory implementations may call this method frequently.
        Returns:
        string array
